title: A slow trek towards gender parity
summary: While there has been progress, there is still a long way to go for the world to achieve gender parity. According to the Global Gender Gap Report 2024, published by the World Economic Forum (WEF) in June, we have closed 68.5% of the gender gap. However, at the current pace, it will take another 134 years – equivalent to five generations – to achieve full gender parity. Globally, the gap has closed by just 0.1 percentage points since last year.
